poem:
Title: A Fool's Gambit

Starmer, across seas in strife,
Mocking green gift of life,
£28bn pledge turned ghost,
Trapped between gain and cost.

Inflation's reduction's muse,
Yet, shame, we willingly lose,
Engulfed in fossil's brief luster,
While earth cries out in cluster.

A game of power and politics,
In climate's clock that ticks,
Disguising fear as wisdom,
In the face of looming chasm.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The Inflation Reduction Act – the Biden White House’s trademark legislative achievement, which revolved around green investments – was a major accomplishment. Still, the US is breaking new records for its production and export of fossil". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
